results.title: Peripheral Artery Disease in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: Survival Analysis of an Ecuadorian Population in Primary Care
results.text_hl: The risk for @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@PAD@@@ was higher in females (95% CI: 1.51-4.38), GFR <60 mL/min/m2 (95% CI: 1.05-2.22) and use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ plus @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ (95% CI: 1.10-2.35).

citations.NLM: Barrera-Guarderas F, Carrasco-Tenezaca F, De la Torre-Cisneros K. Peripheral Artery Disease in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: Survival Analysis of an Ecuadorian Population in Primary Care J Prim Care Community Health. 2020 Jan-Dec;11():2150132720957449. PMID: 33016190

results.title: Occurrence of Major Local Lower Limb Events in Type 2 Diabetic Patients with Lower Extremity Arterial Disease: Impact of Metformin.
results.text_hl: A history of @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@ and a history of @DISEASE_Venous_Thromboembolism @DISEASE_MESH:D054556 @@@venous thromboembolism@@@ were associated with an increased all-cause mortality risk with OR = 3.68; 95% CI [1.17; 11.5]; P = 0.025 and OR = 3.78; 95% CI [1.16; 12.3]; P = 0.027. CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is protective against local complications in people with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@PAD@@@ and should be prescribed to @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@PAD@@@ at an early stage.

citations.NLM: Tan S, Goudot G, Arnoux A, Tran Y, Maissoro H, Poenou G, Detriche G, Khider L, Mohamedi N, Mirault T, Galloula A, Messas E. Occurrence of Major Local Lower Limb Events in Type 2 Diabetic Patients with Lower Extremity Arterial Disease: Impact of Metformin. Ann Vasc Surg. 2022 Oct 28;():. PMID: 36441097

results.title: Imaging the Proangiogenic Effects of Cardiovascular Drugs in a Diabetic Model of Limb Ischemia
results.text_hl: ...Both statins and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ are routinely used clinically in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ and while they have been shown to have proangiogenic properties, they have not displayed the expected functional improvements in @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@PAD@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ when assessed retrospectively.

citations.NLM: Goggi JL, Haslop A, Boominathan R, Chan K, Soh V, Cheng P, Robins EG, Bhakoo KK. Imaging the Proangiogenic Effects of Cardiovascular Drugs in a Diabetic Model of Limb Ischemia Contrast Media Mol Imaging. 2019;2019():2538909. PMID: 30863219

results.title: Metformin Is Associated with Improved Survival and Decreased Cardiac Events with No Impact on Patency and Limb Salvage after Revascularization for Peripheral Arterial Disease.
results.text_hl: The objective of this study was to assess the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on outcomes after intervention for @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@PAD@@@.

citations.NLM: Khan SZ, Rivero M, Nader ND, Cherr GS, Harris LM, Dryjski ML, Dosluoglu HH. Metformin Is Associated with Improved Survival and Decreased Cardiac Events with No Impact on Patency and Limb Salvage after Revascularization for Peripheral Arterial Disease.
